item.title: OAuth consent phishing explained and prevented
item.description: In this series, we've investigated identity attacks that go beyond simple multifactor authentication (MFA), including Adversary-in-the-Middle (AiTM) phishing and Golden SAML attacks . In this installment, we’ll delve into the OAuth consent phishing attack. This attack leverages the OAuth 2.0 protocol, which is widely used for granting third-party applications access to user data without sharing user credentials. As a reminder, the most common attack is account compromise. That’s why it’s so crucial to secure your identity infrastructure, for example, by adopting phishing-resistant MFA. It’s...
